etymologies: late 19th century. From scientific Latin malleus glanders + -in, after coinage by C. Helmann, although it is unclear whether the word was used by him in a French or Russian context and in what spelling

definitions: Any of various preparations containing antigens of the glanders bacterium, Pseudomonas mallei, used especially in skin testing of horses for the disease. Frequently attributive, especially in "mallein test".
